channel.title: What you think?
channel.description: Well im getting a netbook soon probably an ASUS with linux :D but im not sure yet, anyway im thinking of getting this [url=http://www.ebuyer.com/product/143266]http://www.ebuyer.com/product/143266[/url] for when i am @ home and i can then put things from disc onto my netbook(without a disc drive) i thought i would go bluray because it allows me to use bigger discs which have more space on them.

item.title: What you think?
item.dc:creator: @srt8 srt8
item.description:
@srt8 wrote:

I’m getting a Asus eee 10in from newegg.com and i’m super excited. We went to best buy to look at one and to make sure that we liked it first. But I will mostly be using it at school.

Read full topic

item.title: What you think?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

but that wont play discs, i am getting an external USB harddrive this weekend but thats for my windows machine although i might split it up between the two of them 1tb is a fair amount of space

chrisn2323:

if its for home use, why would you need something portable?

its going to be predominantly for home use i will take it to other places with me occasionaly.

Read full topic

item.title: What you think?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

A portable USB harddrive would probably be faster, and definitely cheaper.

Read full topic

item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

if its for home use, why would you need something portable?

item.title: What you think?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

it was more the fact that i could use discs with extra space, whilst still keeping a small portable laptop, it would probably have been mainly for home use.

Read full topic

item.title: What you think?
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:2, topic:257595”]not sure how well netbooks handle the playback of HD. You might want to look into that first.

I recommend just getting a cinema laptop (screen with a 16:9 ratio) with blu-ray instead.[/quote]

Or just get the Vaio P.

Read full topic
